references.paper_title: Accelerating network layouts using graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on using graph neural networks to optimize network layouts, a technique directly applied in the current research for molecular simulations.

This work provides a comprehensive overview of traditional coarse-graining methods in molecular simulations, which serves as a crucial foundation and point of comparison for the novel reparametrization approach proposed in this research.

This is a key reference because it introduces the concept of using overparametrized neural networks as priors to solve inverse problems, which is analogous to the way neural networks are used in this paper to represent molecular systems.

This paper highlights the challenges in traditional molecular dynamics simulations, specifically mentioning the difficulties in navigating complex energy landscapes, which directly motivates the need for the improved methods presented in this research.

references.paper_title: Advances in coarse-grained modeling of macromolecular complexes
references.reason: This paper demonstrates successful applications of coarse-graining methods in molecular simulations, setting a benchmark against which the novel approach is compared and providing insights into the existing state of the art.
